newsitem.title: INDIA: India IPCL commissions product pipelines.
newsitem.headline: India IPCL commissions product pipelines.

text.p: Indian Petrochemicals Corp Ltd said on Saturday it had commissioned pipelines valued at 1.26 billion rupees ($35 million) to transport naptha, ethylene and propylene between its Gandhar and Vadodara complexes.

The pipelines were implemented on a build, own, operate and transfer (BOOT) concept, and will have capacity to transport 400,000 tonnes of naptha annually, 100,000 tonnes of propylene, and 100,000 tonnes of ethylene.

The commissioning of the pipeline and captive jetty in the Narmada river esturary near Gandhar Petrochemicals Complex will provide IPCL with the advantage of importing feedstock at more competitive rates and transfer to either of its complexes, the company said in a press statement.
